intro: Montejacquia blanchetii, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant has succulent leaves and stems, adapted to store water in its native desert environment. It typically grows in rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for xeriscaping. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
